item.title: Mafia: The Old Country is getting a free update filled with challenges, a new difficulty, and an okay-looking cinematic mode
item.content:encoded:
And it's coming very soon!

Anyone order a free Mafia: The Old Country update? Well, whether you did or not, a free update is what you're getting. This one's quite features driven, focusing a lot of challenges and cosmetics, but there's a few new weapons and the like too. Let's take a little look-see!

For starters, this update, titled Free Ride, is due out tomorrow, November 20th, so you've not got long to wait for it. It's similar to the Free Ride mode you might have experienced in Mafia: Definitive Edition, for a frame of reference. Included are different sets of challenges, unconnected to the story, which range from combat, stealth, and racing missions, taking place in some new areas, but also places from the base game. Completing said challenges nets you the in-game Dinari currency to buy things like outfits, weapons, or vehicles. You can also drive in first-person now! Not much to say about that one.

As every single game under the sun now has, there's a photo mode being added in. For those of you up for more of a challenge, the classic difficulty setting will also be available.

Possibly my least favourite addition at just a cursory glance is the game's new "Cinema Siciliano" mode. Think something along the lines of the Akira Kurosawa mode in Ghost of Tsushima - the Cinema Siciliano mode also turns things black and white, adds film grain, and puts a filter on the audio so that it sounds a bit old and crappy. I understand that you're inspired by movies, it just feels weirdly fake and cheap when you slap some filters on top of things and call it a day! You'd need a lighting overall to really capture the appropriate feeling in the first place, but I digress.

The main point is, the update is free, it's coming November 20th, happy mafiaing!

item.title: Ark: Survival Ascended's famous-people-laden expansion Lost Colony gets a December release date
item.content:encoded:
Where are they getting the money for all of this?

Ark is one of those strange series to me that seems to have a ridiculous amount of cash to dispense, what with its star-studded cast in the animated adaptation. Gerard Butler and bloody Michelle Yeoh are in it! Not to mention David Tenant, Elliot Page, Russel Crowe and Vin Diesel, the final of whom is meant to be in the borderline MIA Ark 2. But some of those voices will be appearing in-game through Ark: Survival Ascended's next expansion, Lost Colony, which now has a release date!

Said release date is a little over a month away on December 16th, and according to a press release makes direct connections between Ark's Extinction and Genesis expansions, and Ark 2. It's a little bit of prep work, essentially.

Yeoh is back in her role from the animated series, alongside Tennant as his, as well as cast members like Madeleine Madden (Wheel of Time), Auli'i Cravalho (Moana), Katie Sackhoff (Battlestar Galactica) and Keith David (Coraline).

While this feels like an odd way to put it, Lost Colony adds in the first "canonical" expansion map into Ark: Survival Ascended, though I'm sure the presumably many Ark loreheads can speak to that better than I can. Once you start up the expansion, you'll find yourself in a big ole city where something's hunting you down.

There'll be new abilities, gears, building systems, the usual expansion affair. And from today until the expansion launches, a new dino, the Ossidon, will be wandering around cold-biomes in Ragnarok, Valguero, and The Center. The trailer above puts a spotlight on this admittedly nasty looking beastie. Happy Arking, Arkers! Or Survival Ascending? You get what I mean.
